item.title: The ||kuken
item.summary: The people take a long ostrich wing feather and cut off the root to make a //kuken, or barblet, that makes the arrow stick fast in an animal's flesh. The poison on the barblet dissolves off the barblet into the flesh.
item.comments: 1) See also The ||kuken and ostrich feathers and Feathered arrows and poison and Arrow-making, 2) p.8769v: |han≠kass'o was taught this by his maternal grandfather (Tsatsi) and experienced it himself; arrows with and without barblets, 3) p.8770v: the name for an arrow that is not poisoned, 4) p.8772v: the part of the animal's flesh that the barblet catches on; a man who died from a poisoned wound on his foot (see Gemsbok hunting), 5) This story is found in Book VIII-31
item.author: |han≠kass'o (Klein Jantje) (VIII)
